intro: Cystanthe procera, commonly known as the tall false heather, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cystanthe procera is typically found in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
